text: Come and See (, Idi i smotri; , Idzi i hliadzi) is a 1985 Russian Belarusian World War II drama movie about a boy in the USSR (Russia) during World War 2 in 1943 witnesses the horrific crimes in Belarus where the ruthless Nazi German Armies (of the Wehrmacht’s Nazi Ground Army and the SS’s Waffen-SS army) under the orders of Germany to kill anyone who resisted during the war. Directed by Elem Klimov and starring Aleksei Kravchenko, Liubomiras Laucevičius, Olga Mironova, Vladas Bagdonas. The film is inspired by the crimes of the infamous obscure Nazi SS infantry regiment brigade Commander Oskar Dirlewanger . ==Other websites== * * Category:1985 drama movies Category:1985 war movies Category:Russian drama movies Category:Russian war movies Category:Belarusian movies Category:Movies set in the 1940s Category:Movies about animals Category:Movies about Nazism Category:Movies directed by Elem Klimov Category:World War II movies Category:Movies set in Belarus
